topic.title: Appendix D: How to check that certs were deployed correctly

body.p: The following commands should return the CA certificates used by UCP/DTR. This certificate is the same as the one pointed to by the --cacert switch. If the deployment was not successful, curl will output something like Output 2.
body.codeblock: # curl --cacert <ucp_certs_dir>/ca.pem https://<your ucp fqdn>/ca # curl --cacert <dtr_certs_dir>/ca.pem https://<your dtr fqdn>/ca
body.p: Output 1: certificates successfully deployed (content will depend on your own CA certificate)
Output 2: certificates were not successfully deployed
body.codeblock: curl: (60) Peer's Certificate issuer is not recognized. More details here: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html ...

body.p: Choose Manage computer certificates in the control panel
Import the ca.pem for UCP into the Trusted Root Certification Authorities
